subject: Marketing
title: Repositioning
description: A short lesson to help you apply Repositioning.

hook.text: Old Spice was dying. Average customer age: 60. Then one campaign changed everything.

buildup.text: Repositioning means deliberately changing how the market perceives your brand.

discovery.text: It's necessary when the original position no longer matches the market or the customer.

twist.text: Repositioning is risky. You can alienate loyal customers before new ones arrive.

climax.text: Old Spice kept its heritage but wrapped it in humor. New audience, same brand DNA.

punchline.text: Reposition the perception, not the product.

quiz.question: What does brand repositioning change?
options: How the market perceives the brand
The physical product or service itself
The company's legal name and structure
